context:
Limbo(#2)
Welcome to your new Evennia-based game! Visit https://www.evennia.com if you need
help, want to contribute, report issues or just join the community.

As a privileged user, write batchcommand tutorial_world.build to build
tutorial content. Once built, try intro for starting help and tutorial to
play the demo game.
Exits: tutorial(#4)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
WARNING: You are playing as a superuser (admin). Use the quell command to
play without superuser privileges (many functions and puzzles ignore the 
presence of a superuser, making this mode useful for exploring things behind 
the scenes later).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Intro(#3)
Welcome to the Evennia tutorial-world!

 This small quest shows some examples of Evennia usage.

 To get into the mood of this miniature quest, imagine you are an adventurer
 out to find fame and fortune. You have heard rumours of an old castle ruin by
 the coast. In its depth a warrior princess was buried together with her
 powerful magical weapon - a valuable prize, if it's true.  Of course this is a
 chance to adventure that you cannot turn down!

 You reach the coast in the midst of a raging thunderstorm. With wind and rain
 screaming in your face you stand where the moor meet the sea along a high,
 rocky coast ...

write 'begin' to start your quest!
Exits: exit tutorial(#6) and begin adventure(#10)

Quelling to current puppet's permissions (developer,player, developer).
(Note: If this is higher than Account permissions (superuser), the lowest of the two will be used.)
Use unquell to return to normal permission usage.

 To get into the mood of this miniature quest, imagine you are an adventurer

write 'begin' to start your quest!
Exits: exit tutorial(#6) and begin adventure(#10)

Leaving Tutorial(#5)
You are quitting the Evennia tutorial prematurely! Please come back
 later.
Exits: start again(#7) and exit(#8)

Account permissions (superuser) restored.

==============================================================
 Welcome to test-world, version 3.1.1!

 If you have an existing account, connect to it by typing:
      connect <username> <password>
 If you need to create an account, type (without the <>'s):
      create <username> <password>

 If you have spaces in your username, enclose it in quotes.
 Enter help for more info. look will re-show this screen.

Limbo(#2)
Welcome to your new Evennia-based game! Visit https://www.evennia.com if you need
help, want to contribute, report issues or just join the community.

As a privileged user, write batchcommand tutorial_world.build to build
tutorial content. Once built, try intro for starting help and tutorial to
play the demo game.
Exits: tutorial(#4)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
WARNING: You are playing as a superuser (admin). Use the quell command to
play without superuser privileges (many functions and puzzles ignore the 
presence of a superuser, making this mode useful for exploring things behind 
the scenes later).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Intro(#3)
Welcome to the Evennia tutorial-world!

 This small quest shows some examples of Evennia usage.

 To get into the mood of this miniature quest, imagine you are an adventurer
 out to find fame and fortune. You have heard rumours of an old castle ruin by
 the coast. In its depth a warrior princess was buried together with her
 powerful magical weapon - a valuable prize, if it's true.  Of course this is a
 chance to adventure that you cannot turn down!

 You reach the coast in the midst of a raging thunderstorm. With wind and rain
 screaming in your face you stand where the moor meet the sea along a high,
 rocky coast ...

write 'begin' to start your quest!
Exits: exit tutorial(#6) and begin adventure(#10)

Quelling to current puppet's permissions (developer,player, developer).
(Note: If this is higher than Account permissions (superuser), the lowest of the two will be used.)
Use unquell to return to normal permission usage.

Intro(#3)
Welcome to the Evennia tutorial-world!

 This small quest shows some examples of Evennia usage.

 To get into the mood of this miniature quest, imagine you are an adventurer
 out to find fame and fortune. You have heard rumours of an old castle ruin by
 the coast. In its depth a warrior princess was buried together with her
 powerful magical weapon - a valuable prize, if it's true.  Of course this is a
 chance to adventure that you cannot turn down!

 You reach the coast in the midst of a raging thunderstorm. With wind and rain
 screaming in your face you stand where the moor meet the sea along a high,
 rocky coast ...

write 'begin' to start your quest!
Exits: exit tutorial(#6) and begin adventure(#10)

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

Wooden sign(#12)
The wooden sign sits at the end of a small eastward path. Beyond it
 is the shore-side anchor of the hanging bridge that connects the main
 land with the castle ruin on its desolate cliff. The sign is not as
 old as the rest of the scenery and the text on it is easily readable.

You read Wooden sign:
  WARNING - The bridge is not safe!

 Below this official warning, someone has carved some sprawling
 letters into the wood. It reads: "The guardian will not bleed to
 mortal blade."

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

Old well(#11)
The ruins of an old well sit some way off the path. The stone circle
 has collapsed and whereas there is still a chain hanging down the
 hole, it does not look very secure. It is probably a remnant of some
 old settlement back in the day.

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)
Lightning strikes in several thundering bolts, striking the trees in the forest to your west.

gnarled old tree(#13)
Only the sturdiest of trees survive at the edge of the
 moor. A small huddling black thing has dug in near the
 cliff edge, eternally pummeled by wind and salt to become an integral
 part of the gloomy scenery.

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the the bridge's western foundation. If you go west you will be back
on solid ground ...
A gust of wind causes the bridge to sway precariously.

Some sort of large bird sweeps by overhead, giving off an eery screech. Soon it has disappeared in
the gloom.
Command 'n' is not available. Maybe you meant "unban" or "unlink"?

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the the bridge's western foundation. If you go west you will be back
on solid ground ...
From the castle you hear a distant howling sound, like that of a large dog or other beast.

The old bridge
The bridge slopes precariously where it extends eastwards towards the lowest point - the center
point of the hang bridge.
You clasp the ropes firmly as the bridge sways and creaks under you.

The old bridge
You are halfways out on the unstable bridge.
The bridge creaks under your feet. Those planks does not seem very sturdy.

The old bridge
The bridge slopes precariously where it extends westwards towards the lowest point - the center
point of the hang bridge.
From the castle you hear a distant howling sound, like that of a large dog or other beast.

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the bridge's eastern foundation. If you go east you will be back on
solid ground ...
Far below you the ocean roars and throws its waves against the cliff, as if trying its best to reach
you.

Ruined gatehouse(#29)
The old gatehouse is near collapse. Part of its northern wall has
 already fallen down, together with parts of the fortifications in
 that direction.  Heavy stone pillars hold up sections of ceiling, but
 elsewhere the flagstones are exposed to open sky. Part of a heavy
 portcullis, formerly blocking off the inner castle from attack, is
 sprawled over the ground together with most of its frame.

 East the gatehouse leads out to a small open area surrounded by
 the remains of the castle.  There is also a standing archway
 offering passage to a path along the old southern inner wall.
Exits: Bridge over the abyss(#30), Standing archway(#32), and castle corner(#35)

Along inner wall(#31)
What appears at first sight to be a series of connected rooms
 actually turns out to be collapsed buildings so mashed together by
 the ravages of time that they all seem to lean on each other and
 against the outer wall. The whole scene is directly open to the sky.

 The buildings make a half-circle along the main wall, here and there
 broken by falling stone and rubble. At one end (the northern) of
 this half-circle is the entrance to the castle, the ruined
 gatehouse. Eastwards from here is some sort of open courtyard.
Exits: ruined gatehouse(#33) and overgrown courtyard(#44)

Ruined gatehouse(#29)
The old gatehouse is near collapse. Part of its northern wall has
 already fallen down, together with parts of the fortifications in
 that direction.  Heavy stone pillars hold up sections of ceiling, but
 elsewhere the flagstones are exposed to open sky. Part of a heavy
 portcullis, formerly blocking off the inner castle from attack, is
 sprawled over the ground together with most of its frame.

 East the gatehouse leads out to a small open area surrounded by
 the remains of the castle.  There is also a standing archway
 offering passage to a path along the old southern inner wall.
Exits: Bridge over the abyss(#30), Standing archway(#32), and castle corner(#35)
Command 'norner' is not available. Maybe you meant "corner" or "inventory"?

Corner of castle ruins(#34)
The ruins opens up to the sky in a small open area, lined by
 columns. The open area is dominated by a huge stone obelisk in its
 center, an ancient ornament miraculously still standing.

 Previously one could probably continue past the obelisk and eastward
 into the castle keep itself, but that way is now completely blocked
 by fallen rubble. To the west is the gatehouse and entrance to
 the castle, whereas southwards the columns make way for a wide
 open courtyard.
Exits: gatehouse(#36) and courtyard(#41)
You see: a Ghostly apparition(#38) and an obelisk(#37)
Ghostly apparition slash at you with foggy tentacles. It's a hit!
Ghostly apparition slash at you with foggy tentacles. It's a hit!
Ghostly apparition stabs at you with foggy tentacles. They miss you.
Command 'fatehouse' is not available. Maybe you meant "gatehouse", "@sethome" or "sethelp"?

Ghostly apparition stabs at you with foggy tentacles. It's a hit!
You fall to the ground, defeated. As you do, the ghostly apparition dives
 forward and engulf you.


 The world turns black.
The room is completely dark.

Until you find some light, there's not much you can do. Try feeling around, maybe you'll find
something helpful!

Until you find some light, there's not much you can do. Try feeling around, maybe you'll find
something helpful!

Until you find some light, there's not much you can do. Try feeling around, maybe you'll find
something helpful!

Until you find some light, there's not much you can do. Try feeling around, maybe you'll find
something helpful!
Blind, you think you find some sort of object on the ground, but it turns out to be just a stone.
You can't see anything, but the air is damp. It feels like you are far underground.

Blind, you bump into a wall. The wall seems to be covered with some sort of vegetation, but its too
damp to burn.
Blind, you think you find some sort of object on the ground, but it turns out to be just a stone.

Your fingers bump against a splinter of wood in a corner. It smells of resin and seems dry enough to
burn! You pick it up, holding it firmly. Now you just need to light it using the flint and steel you 
carry with you.

The room is lit up.
You light splinter.

Dark cell(#27)
The flickering light of your makeshift light reveals a small square
 cell. It does not seem like you are still in the castle, for the
 stone of the walls are chiseled crudely and drip with water and mold.

 One wall holds a solid iron-cast door. While rusted and covered with
 lichen it seems very sturdy. In a corner lies what might have once
 been a bed or a bench but is now nothing more than a pile of splinters,
 one of which you are using for light. One of the walls is covered with a
 thick cover of black roots having broken through the cracks from the
 outside.
Exits: root-covered wall(#28)
No matter how you try, you cannot force yourself through root-covered wall.

root-covered wall(#28)
The wall is old and covered with roots that here and there have permeated the stone. The roots (or
whatever they are - some of them are covered in small nondescript flowers) crisscross the wall, 
making it hard to clearly see its stony surface. Maybe you could try to shift or move them (like 
'shift red up').

The thin horizontal-hanging root with yellow flowers passes right over the middle of the wall.
The weedy green horizontal root passes right over the middle of the wall.
The reddish vertical-hanging root hangs straight down the middle of the wall.
The thick vertical root with blue flowers hangs straight down the middle of the wall.

shift yellow up
(mapper): (error): Not mapping
Command 'yellow up' is not available. Maybe you meant "pull"?
You must define which colour of root you want to move, and in which direction.
You shift the root with small yellow flowers upwards.

root-covered wall(#28)
The wall is old and covered with roots that here and there have permeated the stone. The roots (or
whatever they are - some of them are covered in small nondescript flowers) crisscross the wall, 
making it hard to clearly see its stony surface. Maybe you could try to shift or move them (like 
'shift red up').

The thin horizontal-hanging root with yellow flowers covers the upper part of the wall.
The weedy green horizontal root passes right over the middle of the wall.
The reddish vertical-hanging root hangs straight down the middle of the wall.
The thick vertical root with blue flowers hangs straight down the middle of the wall.
You shove the weedy green root downwards.
You shift the reddish root to the left.

You shove the root adorned with small blue flowers to the right.
Holding aside the root you think you notice something behind it ...

root-covered wall(#28)
Having moved all the roots aside, you find that the center of the wall, previously hidden by the
vegetation, hid a curious square depression. It was maybe once concealed and made to look a part of 
the wall, but with the crumbling of stone around it, it's now easily identifiable as some sort of 
button.
No matter how you try, you cannot force yourself through root-covered wall.
Could not find 'button'.

You move your fingers over the suspicious depression, then gives it a decisive push. First nothing
happens, then there is a rumble and a hidden passage opens, dust and pebbles rumbling as part of the 
wall moves aside.

Dark cell(#27)
The flickering light of your makeshift light reveals a small square
 cell. It does not seem like you are still in the castle, for the
 stone of the walls are chiseled crudely and drip with water and mold.

 One wall holds a solid iron-cast door. While rusted and covered with
 lichen it seems very sturdy. In a corner lies what might have once
 been a bed or a bench but is now nothing more than a pile of splinters,
 one of which you are using for light. One of the walls is covered with a
 thick cover of black roots having broken through the cracks from the
 outside.
Exits: root-covered wall(#28)

The room is completely dark.
Underground passages(#24)
The underground cavern system you have entered seems to stretch on
 forever, with criss-crossing paths and natural caverns probably
 carved by water. It is not completely dark, here and there faint
 daylight sifts down from above - the cliff is porous leaving channels
 of air and light up to the surface.


 (some time later)


 You eventually come upon a cavern with a black pool of stale
 water. In it sits a murky bucket, the first remnant of any sort of
 intelligent life down here. The bucket has disconnected from a chain
 hanging down from a circular opening high above. Gray daylight
 simmers down the hole together with rain that ripples the black
 surface of the pool.
Exits: climb the chain(#26)
Your splinter flickers and dies.

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

admin(#1)
This is User #1.
You hear the distant howl of what sounds like some sort of dog or wolf.

old bridge(#22)
The hanging bridge's foundation sits at the edge of the cliff to the
 east - two heavy stone pillars anchor the bridge on this side. The
 bridge sways precariously in the storm.

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the the bridge's western foundation. If you go west you will be back
on solid ground ...
The bridge creaks under your feet. Those planks does not seem very sturdy.
Suddenly the plank you stand on gives way under your feet! You fall!
You try to grab hold of an adjoining plank, but all you manage to do is to divert your fall
westwards, towards the cliff face. This is going to hurt ... 
 ... The world goes dark ...


Protruding ledge(#23)
You are on a narrow ledge protruding from the side of the cliff,
 about halfway down.  The air is saturated with salty sea water,
 sprays hitting your face from the crashing waves below.

 The ledge is covered with a few black-grey brushes. Not far from you
 the cliff-face is broken down to reveal a narrow natural opening into
 the cliff. High above you the bridge sways and creaks in the wind.
Exits: hole into cliff(#25)
Protruding ledge(#23)
You are on a narrow ledge protruding from the side of the cliff,
 about halfway down.  The air is saturated with salty sea water,
 sprays hitting your face from the crashing waves below.

 The ledge is covered with a few black-grey brushes. Not far from you
 the cliff-face is broken down to reveal a narrow natural opening into
 the cliff. High above you the bridge sways and creaks in the wind.
Exits: hole into cliff(#25)

Underground passages(#24)
The underground cavern system you have entered seems to stretch on
 forever, with criss-crossing paths and natural caverns probably
 carved by water. It is not completely dark, here and there faint
 daylight sifts down from above - the cliff is porous leaving channels
 of air and light up to the surface.


 (some time later)


 You eventually come upon a cavern with a black pool of stale
 water. In it sits a murky bucket, the first remnant of any sort of
 intelligent life down here. The bucket has disconnected from a chain
 hanging down from a circular opening high above. Gray daylight
 simmers down the hole together with rain that ripples the black
 surface of the pool.
Exits: climb the chain(#26)

Cliff by the coast(#9)
You stand on the high coast line overlooking a stormy sea far
 below. Around you the ground is covered in low gray-green grass,
 pushed flat by wind and rain. Inland, the vast dark moors begin, only
 here and there covered in patches of low trees and brushes.

 To the east, you glimpse the ragged outline of a castle ruin. It sits
 perched on a sheer cliff out into the water, isolated from the
 shore. The only way to reach it seems by way of an old hanging bridge,
 anchored not far east from here.
Exits: old bridge(#22)
You see: an Old well(#11), a Wooden sign(#12), and a gnarled old tree(#13)

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the the bridge's western foundation. If you go west you will be back
on solid ground ...
The hanging bridge creaks dangerously.

The old bridge
The bridge slopes precariously where it extends eastwards towards the lowest point - the center
point of the hang bridge.
The bridge sways in the wind.

The old bridge
You are halfways out on the unstable bridge.
A gust of wind causes the bridge to sway precariously.

The old bridge
The bridge slopes precariously where it extends westwards towards the lowest point - the center
point of the hang bridge.
From the castle you hear a distant howling sound, like that of a large dog or other beast.

The old bridge
You are standing very close to the bridge's eastern foundation. If you go east you will be back on
solid ground ...
Under your feet a plank comes loose, tumbling down. For a moment you dangle over the abyss ...

Ruined gatehouse(#29)
The old gatehouse is near collapse. Part of its northern wall has
 already fallen down, together with parts of the fortifications in
 that direction.  Heavy stone pillars hold up sections of ceiling, but
 elsewhere the flagstones are exposed to open sky. Part of a heavy
 portcullis, formerly blocking off the inner castle from attack, is
 sprawled over the ground together with most of its frame.

 East the gatehouse leads out to a small open area surrounded by
 the remains of the castle.  There is also a standing archway
 offering passage to a path along the old southern inner wall.
Exits: Bridge over the abyss(#30), Standing archway(#32), and castle corner(#35)

Corner of castle ruins(#34)
The ruins opens up to the sky in a small open area, lined by
 columns. The open area is dominated by a huge stone obelisk in its
 center, an ancient ornament miraculously still standing.

 Previously one could probably continue past the obelisk and eastward
 into the castle keep itself, but that way is now completely blocked
 by fallen rubble. To the west is the gatehouse and entrance to
 the castle, whereas southwards the columns make way for a wide
 open courtyard.
Exits: gatehouse(#36) and courtyard(#41)
You see: an obelisk(#37)
It's way too heavy for anyone to move.

obelisk(#37)
The surface of the obelisk seem to waver, shift and writhe under your gaze, with different scenes
and structures appearing whenever you look at it. You can briefly make out the image of a woman with 
a blue bird.
Could not find 'woman'.

Overgrown courtyard(#40)
The inner courtyard of the old castle is littered with debris and
 overgrown with low grass and patches of thorny vines. There is a
 collapsed structure close to the gatehouse that looks like a stable.

 Northwards is a smaller area cornered in the debris, adorned with
 a large obelisk-like thing. To the west the castle walls loom
 over a mess of collapsed buildings. On the opposite, eastern side
 of the yard is a large building with a curved roof that seem to have
 withstood the test of time better than many of those around it, it
 looks like some sort of temple.
Exits: castle corner(#42), along inner wall(#43), and ruined temple(#46)

The ruined temple(#45)
This building seems to have survived the ravages of time better than
 most of the others. Its arched roof and wide spaces suggests that
 this is a temple or church of some kind.


 The wide hall of the temple stretches before you. At the far edge is
 a stone altar with no clear markings. Despite its relatively good
 condition, the temple is empty of all furniture or valuables, like it
 was looted or its treasures moved ages ago.

 Stairs lead down to the temple's dungeon on either side of the
 altar. A gaping door opening shows the a wide courtyard to the west.
Exits: overgrown courtyard(#47) and stairs down(#49)

Antechamber(#48)
This chamber lies almost directly under the main altar of the
 temple. The passage of aeons is felt here and you also sense you are
 close to great power.

 The sides of the chamber are lined with stone archways, these are
 entrances to the tombs of what must have been influential
 families or individual heroes of the realm. Each is adorned by a
 stone statue or symbol of fine make. They do not seem to be ordered
 in any particular order or rank.
Exits: up the stairs to ruined temple(#50), Blue bird tomb(#52), Tomb of woman on horse(#54), Tomb
of the crowned queen(#56), Tomb of the shield(#58), and Tomb of the hero(#60)
Command 'bird tomb' is not available. Maybe you meant "blue bird tomb" or "bird"?

The tomb is dark. You fumble your way through it. You think you can
 make out a coffin in front of you in the gloom.

 The coffin comes into view. On and around it are chiseled scenes of a
 stern woman in armor. They depict great heroic deeds. This is clearly
 the tomb of some sort of ancient heroine - it must be the goal you
 have been looking for!
Ancient tomb(#61)
Apart from the ornate sarcophagus, the tomb is bare from extra decorations.
 This is the resting place of a warrior with little patience for
 glamour and trinkets. You have reached the end of your quest.
Exits: back to antechamber(#62)
You see: a Stone sarcophagus(#63)

Stone sarcophagus(#63)
The lid of the coffin is adorned with a stone statue in full size.
The weapon held by the stone hands looks very realistic ...

 The hands of the statue close on what seems to be a real weapon
rather than one in stone.  This must be the hero's legendary weapon!
The prize you have been looking for!

 (try get weapon)

Trembling you carefully release the weapon from the stone to test
 its weight. You are finally holding your prize,

  The Silver Warhammer

 in your hands!

 This concludes the Evennia tutorial. From here you can either
 continue to explore the castle (hint: this weapon works better
 against the castle guardian than any you might have found earlier) or
 you can choose to exit.

End of tutorial(#64)
Thanks for trying out this little Evennia tutorial!


 The game play given here is of course just scraping the surface of
 what can be done with Evennia. The tutorial focuses more on showing
 various techniques than to supply any sort of novel storytelling or
 gaming challenge.  The full README and source code for the tutorial
 world can be found under contrib/tutorials/tutorial_world.


 If you went through the tutorial quest once, it can be interesting to
 do it again to explore the various possibilities and rooms you might
 not have come across yet, maybe with the source/build code next to
 you.  If you play as superuser (user #1) the mobile will ignore you
 and teleport rooms etc will not affect you (this will also disable all
 locks, so keep that in mind when checking functionality).
Exits: exit back to Limbo(#66)

Account permissions (superuser) restored.
Limbo(#2)
Welcome to your new Evennia-based game! Visit https://www.evennia.com if you need
help, want to contribute, report issues or just join the community.

As a privileged user, write batchcommand tutorial_world.build to build
tutorial content. Once built, try intro for starting help and tutorial to
play the demo game.
Exits: tutorial(#4)
